interactions.description: Paracetamol may increase the anticoagulant effect of warfarin, increasing bleeding risk.
interactions.recommendation: Monitor INR levels closely. Consider alternative pain relief.

interactions.description: Both are NSAIDs. Combined use increases risk of gastrointestinal bleeding and ulcers.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid concurrent use. Use only one NSAID at a time.

interactions.description: Increased risk of bleeding due to combined antiplatelet and anticoagulant effects.
interactions.recommendation: Use with extreme caution. Monitor for bleeding signs.

interactions.description: Alcohol increases risk of lactic acidosis with metformin.
interactions.recommendation: Advise patient to avoid alcohol consumption.

interactions.description: Antacids reduce absorption of ciprofloxacin, decreasing effectiveness.
interactions.recommendation: Take ciprofloxacin 2 hours before or 6 hours after antacids.

interactions.description: Clarithromycin increases atorvastatin levels, raising risk of muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis).
interactions.recommendation: Consider alternative antibiotic or statin dose reduction.

interactions.description: Amlodipine increases simvastatin levels, increasing risk of muscle toxicity.
interactions.recommendation: Limit simvastatin dose to 20mg daily when used with amlodipine.

interactions.description: Amiodarone increases digoxin levels, risk of digoxin toxicity.
interactions.recommendation: Reduce digoxin dose by 50% and monitor levels closely.

interactions.description: Calcium reduces absorption of levothyroxine.
interactions.recommendation: Separate administration by at least 4 hours.

interactions.description: Omeprazole may reduce effectiveness of clopidogrel.
interactions.recommendation: Consider alternative PPI like pantoprazole.

interactions.description: Both prolong QT interval, risk of fatal arrhythmias.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. Use alternative antibiotic.

interactions.description: Increased risk of serotonin syndrome (confusion, agitation, rapid heart rate).
interactions.recommendation: Monitor closely for serotonin syndrome symptoms.

interactions.description: Disulfiram-like reaction: severe nausea, vomiting, flushing, headache.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid alcohol during treatment and for 48 hours after.

interactions.description: Fluconazole increases phenytoin levels, risk of toxicity.
interactions.recommendation: Monitor phenytoin levels and adjust dose accordingly.

interactions.description: Beta-blockers may mask hypoglycemia symptoms.
interactions.recommendation: Monitor blood glucose more frequently.

interactions.description: ACE inhibitors increase potassium levels, risk of hyperkalemia.
interactions.recommendation: Monitor potassium levels regularly.

interactions.description: Increased risk of GI bleeding and cardiovascular events.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. Use single NSAID.

interactions.description: Increased drowsiness and impaired coordination.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid alcohol during treatment.

interactions.description: Increased risk of gastrointestinal ulceration and bleeding.
interactions.recommendation: Use gastroprotective agent if combination necessary.

interactions.description: Amoxicillin may increase methotrexate toxicity.
interactions.recommendation: Monitor for methotrexate side effects.
